title.narrative: Youth Development and Juvenile Justice (Kari Yu!)

description.narrative: This program is designed to provide life skills, technical and vocational education and training and job placement opportunities for youth who are at risk of dropping out of the educational system, early school leavers and youth who have been in conflict with the law. Youth between the ages of 15-24 who fall within these three target groups are eligible to participate in the program. The program also aims to strengthen Surinames juvenile justice system. This program is funded by the United States Agency for International Development (USAID).
